Sentencas: BaIn0.3Ti0.7O2.85 (BIT07) is a promising electrolyte for solid oxide fuel cells, due to its chemical compatibility with most of the cathode electrode material such as LSM and Ln2NiO4.
Titulo: Fabrication and Characterization of Anode-Supported BaIn0.3Ti0.7O2.85 Thin Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The present work is aimed on the fabrication of anode-supported half cells with thin BIT07 electrolyte.
Titulo: Fabrication and Characterization of Anode-Supported BaIn0.3Ti0.7O2.85 Thin Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: For this, Ni-8YSZ cermet was chosen due to its excellent mechanical and electrochemical properties, in addition to its low cost.
Titulo: Fabrication and Characterization of Anode-Supported BaIn0.3Ti0.7O2.85 Thin Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The NiO8YSZ anode support was prepared by tape casting, and for this, an organic slurry formulation was optimized.
Titulo: Fabrication and Characterization of Anode-Supported BaIn0.3Ti0.7O2.85 Thin Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The BIT07 electrolyte thin film was deposited through screen printing on the green anode.
Titulo: Fabrication and Characterization of Anode-Supported BaIn0.3Ti0.7O2.85 Thin Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The formulation of the ink was optimized, and sintering at 1350 degrees C for 3 h led to a dense electrolyte with controlled thickness varying from 2 to 12 mu m. Further, the cermet electrode still had a homogeneous microstructure with well-defined anode/electrolyte interface.
Titulo: Fabrication and Characterization of Anode-Supported BaIn0.3Ti0.7O2.85 Thin Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The electrode ASR was about 0.5 O cm2 and was stable over 500 h at 800 degrees C under H23%
Titulo: Fabrication and Characterization of Anode-Supported BaIn0.3Ti0.7O2.85 Thin Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell
Fabrication and Characterization of Anode-Supported BaIn0.3Ti0.7O2.85 Thin Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The fabrications of half cells were successfully scaled up to 100 mm X 100 mm retaining the dimensional control and without any surface defects.
Titulo: Fabrication and Characterization of Anode-Supported BaIn0.3Ti0.7O2.85 Thin Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell
